folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
(1)
Richmond Terrace, at the S.W. corner of Heberton Avenue. The real estate atlases from 1894 to 1917 show these houses to be on the McSorley property.
July 29, 1929

P. L. Sperr

(2)
The Heberton Avenue side of the old building.
November 4, 1931

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue

folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Richmond Terrace, east side, about 100 feet north of Heberton Avenue, at the N.E. corner of the Staten Island Railroad tracks, showing the signal tower and buildings of the Burlee Dry Dock Company.

May 22, 1929

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue

folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
Richmond Terrace (buildings thereon), north side, between Heberton and Richmond Avenues, showing the Jewett Works of the National Lead Company. The view is from near the Staten Island Railroad tracks.

May 22, 1929

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue

folder: Richmond Terrace & Heberton Avenue, Staten Island, NY
text:
1975 to 1967 Richmond Terrace, east side, at the head of Heberton Avenue, and south from the Staten Island Railroad tracks. The sign in the lunch room window (No. 1971) reads: "Full Gospel Mission, Church of God, all are welcome."

May 22, 1929

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Heberton Avenue
